common_issues.title: PiecesOS Fails to Launch After Update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, often getting stuck on "Ensure Core Dependency" after an update. This issue appears primarily on Windows and might be related to hardware requirements. Proposed solutions include reinstalling, trying the AppInstaller build, or waiting for the patch (v11.1.1 aimed to address this but some users still face issues).

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of Issue #613 on GitHub

This issue concerns problems encountered by multiple users with the PiecesOS software.

### Key Points Raised:

* **Slow Boot-up:** PiecesOS would take a long time to start up, sometimes exceeding two hours.
* **Stuck in "Ensure Core Dependency" Stage:** The application would get stuck on the "Ensure Core Dependency" step, preventing full functionality.
* **Unable to Open Copilot Service:** The Copilot service, crucial for PiecesOS functionality, wouldn't open.
* **Missing Tray Icon:** The systray icon for os_server.exe, the main server process, wouldn't appear.
* **Handshake Error:** Users reported "HandshakeException" errors upon launch.
* **Windows-Specific Issues:** Some users reported encountering the problem on Windows systems with older processors.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* **Migration from Previous Stack:** The Pieces team undertook a major data migration from their previous stack to a new one, which might have caused the slow boot-up issue.
* **AppInstaller Build:** Users were suggested to try the appInstaller build, which apparently helped some resolve the issue.
* **Reinstalling PiecesOS:** For Windows users, reinstalling the application or trying a specific download link provided by the Pieces team often resolved the problem.
* **Increased Server Capacity:** The Pieces team acknowledged encountering high server load, causing the reported issues for many users. They increased server capacity to address the problem.
* **New Build (11.1.1):** The Pieces team released a new build (11.1.1) addressing the major issues. Users were encouraged to update to this version for resolution.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* Most users seem to have had the issue resolved after installing the 11.1.1 build. 
* Some users, including JasonDWilson, still encountered problems with the new build. 
* The Pieces team offered further support and investigation for these users.


## Additional Notes:

* The issue primarily affected Windows users.
* The specific cause of the problem remains unclear.
* Ongoing efforts are underway to investigate residual issues and further improve the application.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS experiencing performance issues and crashes
common_issues.description: Users are reporting high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and crashes with the Pieces OS desktop app on Linux and macOS.  The issues seem to stem from LTM-1 algorithm, Flutter bugs on certain Linux Mint versions, and problems with the vector library on macOS. Proposed solutions include disabling LTM-1, disabling the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings on Linux Mint, and waiting for an upcoming patch from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint 22.1] Pieces OS high CPU usage
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces OS has high CPU usage even when idle and no LLM output is processing. Closing the desktop app or any other app with integrations like VScode makes no difference. The CPU usage sometimes drops down to 0% but immediately picks up back to 90%+. 
I dont have any local LLMs or any of the browser plugins installed. I am aware that similar issue was raised last year and was supposed to be fixed in 11.1.0, maybe it wasn't fixed entirely.


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3bedac0a-c9aa-48b9-a86a-6a3c4698d263
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @94tejas reported PiecesOS utilizing excessive RAM and CPU resources.
* The bot suggested related issues and resources to explore.
* @mark-at-pieces attributed the issue to the LTM-1 algorithm and proposed disabling it for improved performance.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS consuming excessive resources, potentially due to LTM-1.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disabling LTM-1 for reduced resource consumption.
* Cloud processing (enrichment mode) option for offloading computationally demanding tasks.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Disabling LTM resolved the user's issue.
* User will explore cloud processing option later with higher local compute capabilities.

**Additional Notes:**

* The team is actively working on optimizing LTM-1.
* Users can adjust LTM and enrichment settings as needed.

**Overall:**

The issue was effectively addressed by disabling LTM, offering a solution for improved performance. Future optimization efforts should further minimize resource utilization.

related_issues.title: [Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
[Linux Mint] Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Freezing on Linux Mint

**Key Points:**

* User reported Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint.
* The issue was identified as a known Flutter problem with TextFields on certain versions of Linux Mint.
* Disabling the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings resolved the issue for the user.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces app freezing on Linux Mint due to a Flutter bug.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Disabling the virtual keyboard in accessibility settings as a workaround.
* The Pieces team will keep an eye on the Flutter issue and patch ASAP.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue resolved for the user with the workaround.
* The Pieces team is monitoring the situation and will implement a permanent fix when available.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue #625: Unable to launch PiecesOS on macOS

**Key Points Raised:**

- User (@gonzososa) is unable to launch PiecesOS on macOS after updating to version 11.1.0. This is similar to other reported issues ([#615](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/615), [#624](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/624), [#621](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/621)).

**Problems Identified:**

- The new vector library has AVX2 issues on various systems, causing launch problems.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- The Pieces team is actively working on a fix and plans to release a new version with the solution soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

- The issue is currently under investigation. @gonzososa provided their CPU information, and the team is analyzing it.
- Users are encouraged to wait for the upcoming update.

**Additional Notes:**

- The Pieces team is using system commands like `sysctl -n machdep.cpu.brand_string` and `system_profiler SPHardwareDataType` to gather information about users' systems and diagnose the problem.

**Next Steps:**

- The Pieces team will release an update with the fix for this issue. 

**Overall, this issue is currently under investigation, but a fix is expected soon.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS failing to launch after update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after a recent update, specifically version 11.1.1. The issue seems to stem from stricter hardware requirements, particularly the need for AVX2 support. A patch is expected to be released to address this, with temporary solutions involving providing system specs to support or waiting for the upcoming fix.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation for Pieces App 

**Key Points:**

* GetReal444 reported an issue booting up the Pieces app.
* The issue appears to be related to AVX2 not being supported on GetReal444's processor.
* This issue affects more users than initially expected.

**Problems Identified:**

* Database service requires AVX2, which isn't available on GetReal444's CPU.
* Pieces team didn't anticipate the number of users affected by this requirement.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is working on a patch to resolve the issue.
* A temporary fix is to provide the technology specifications of your machine to Pieces support.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Patch expected within 24-48 hours (as of February 11).
* Release addressing issue expected on February 14, 2025.

**Additional Notes:**

* This conversation is a continuation of another issue that was already addressed.
* Pieces team is actively engaged in resolving the matter and providing updates.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Failing to Launch After Update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch, particularly after updating to version 11.1.1. This issue appears across macOS and Windows. Proposed solutions include ensuring compatibility with M1 chips on macOS and waiting for a patch addressing stricter hardware requirements on Windows.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Conversation Summary:

**Key Points:**

* PASimmons encountered an issue where Pieces for developers wouldn't run on their M1 Mac.
* Pieces support offered suggestions to troubleshoot:
    * Killing "pieces_qdrant_server" process in activity monitor.
    * Providing com.pieces.os support logs.
    * Downloading and installing the correct ARM version of Pieces for developers.
* PASimmons confirmed they used the Apple Silicon download link and that Pieces now works.

**Problems Identified:**

* PASimmons was using the wrong version of Pieces for developers (not ARM compatible) on their M1 Mac.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Download and install the correct ARM version of Pieces for developers.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue is resolved. PASimmons confirmed Pieces for developers is working after installing the ARM version.

**Additional Notes:**

* The "com.pieces.os support logs" were not required to troubleshoot the issue in this case.
* Pieces support acknowledged an ongoing announcement related to ARM builds (#615).

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Your Pieces OS Version

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

my pieces os was working but now its not working. when i install it it was working after upfate its not working
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** PiecesOS was unable to launch.

**Author:** Danica121

**Date:** February 14, 2025

**Key Points:**

* Danica121 reported the issue and received an automated response from the Pieces-support-bot.
* The bot provided potential solutions:
    * Related issues: PiecesOS was unable to launch., Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version, Pieces OS won't run.
    * Resources: Existing Issues, Documentation, YouTube Channel.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch.
* The cause of the problem is not explicitly mentioned.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review the provided resources for potential solutions.
* If the issue persists, provide additional details to the Pieces support team. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is currently open and awaiting further information from Danica121.
* The Pieces support team will follow up within 24 hours.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving launch failures:** The most frequent and active tickets relate to PiecesOS failing to launch after the 11.1.1 update, particularly on Windows due to stricter hardware requirements. Focus on resolving this urgently.

**Investigate and address performance issues:** Several users report high CPU usage, unresponsiveness, and crashes, especially on Linux and macOS. Allocate resources to identify the root causes and implement fixes.

**Improve communication about hardware requirements:** The launch failures highlight the need for clearer communication about updated hardware requirements, particularly AVX2 support. Update system requirements documentation and announcements.
**Review and optimize LTM-1 algorithm:**  High resource consumption related to LTM-1 is a recurring issue. Investigate optimizing the algorithm or provide clearer guidance on disabling it.

**Monitor Flutter-related issues on Linux Mint:**  Address the freezing issue on specific Linux Mint versions stemming from Flutter bugs. Explore workarounds or prioritize a permanent fix in collaboration with the Flutter community.
